title: Apologia Pro Vita Sua
summary:
Key ideas
- A patient struggling with addiction is hesitant to spend $100 a week on medication
- The patient spends more money on buying drugs than on medication
- Addiction makes it difficult to prioritize anything above feeding the addiction
- The author apologizes for being too busy to help people

Key learnings
- Addiction creates an environment in which drugs come before all other expenses
- Addiction is a powerful force that requires people to make difficult choices
- Time is a non-fungible resource, and working on enjoyable activities drains less energy and willpower

Key questions
- How can addiction be effectively treated if patients prioritize buying drugs over the cost of medication?
- Can addiction be overcome without a complete lifestyle overhaul?
- How can people manage their time and energy to accomplish the important things in life while still finding time for enjoyable activities?
